title: Borderlands
notes: One thing you need to do: run the game and exit. And you're done. Optional: You can tweak graphics/mouse smoothig for performance via game configuration file, just like in Windows, because game is not well running even in native Windows. You can find these files in "/home/<YourUsername>/.local/share/Steam/steamapps/compatdata/8980/pfx/drive_c/users/steamuser/My Documents/my games/borderlands/WillowGame/Config". But even without this, Borderlands is very stable and works excelent.
specs: Intel® Core™2 Quad CPU Q9550 / GTX 760 2GB

title: Borderlands
notes: There is a performance hit with shadows. This same issue was present in the game running on Windows 10 on several machines, both mine and others. There are additionally mouse sensitivity issues and some judder in animations when they are made for the first time, or when new areas are visited.

title: Borderlands
notes: In the binaries folder, "cudart.dll" needs to be copied to "physxcudart_20.dll" or the game will complain about a missing Borderlands.exe file. Afterwards, the game runs completely fine, no issues or flaws at all!

title: Borderlands
notes:
The game crahed on first launch with the error message:
General protection fault! History: Address = 0xaae5fa (filename not found)
To fix this you have to create a copy (!) of the cudart.dll and rename it to physxcudart_20.dll. Both cudart.dll and physxcudart_20.dll have to be in the Borderlands/Binaries directory. Without this the game does not start. After that there are no issues.
Game played with no issues in default configuration.
title: Borderlands

gpu: X.Org AMD Radeon (TM) RX 480 Graphics (POLARIS10, DRM 3.23.0, 4.15.0-33-generic, LLVM 8.0.0)
notes:
Worked out of the box, with native performances. I could play the whole story in Solo till the credits
I also tried one DLC (The Zombie Island of Dr. Ned) with same results
The few minor issues I encountered were
- in the middle of the story had once a game crash which didn't occur again
- depending on the display resolution or if going out and in the game with alt-tab it limits the mouse to some boundaries. If you have a kind of sticky mouse  boundaries, adjust your resolution and it should solve it
I didn't try multiplayer

title: Borderlands

notes: Played from level 1 to level 69 (PT 2.5 including all DLCs). Performance was good and had no issues regarding mouse or sound. However, I did experience random crashes throughout the game. Those were especially punishing in the DLCs which only have a single fast travel station. Which means sometimes you travel across two maps, clear an entire area and then it crashes, meaning you have to do everything again. From my experience the crashes were totally random (sometimes it would run fine for two hours straight, sometimes it would crash three times in 10 minutes). All in all I still consider it playable, but the crashes certainly dampened the mood for me.
title: Borderlands

gpu: X.Org Radeon RX 560 Series (POLARIS11, DRM 3.26.0, 4.18.12-zen1-1-zen, LLVM 7.0.0)
notes: Initially low framerates, but after setting 'AllowD3D10=True' in WillowGame.ini I saw serious improvement. Still a performance hit depending on the area and where I look, but it's entirely playable. Adjusting graphics options did not help.
